column4: hello, i have a problem, i resized the swap partition and the computer would not reboot, i tried like 6 times and it didnt work the 7th time it booted......
it even said that it predicted a failure
what size?   my system never even uses the swap part
i used the auto install and it made the swap like 40 gigs and after learning about linux i resized it to 2 gigs today
i doubt you'll ever need a 2 gig swap part..  just fyi...
but now it works and now i fear that i may have a problem larger then i think
it sounds like your FAT was messed with...
i have 2 gigs of memory and i hibernate every time i turn off the computer
but thats not the issue right now, i need to make sure everything is ok, and that i do not need to restore any of the file system before i reboot
yes, in light of that, disregard what I said.
You could use gparted to take a look if the partitions were okay...
i did not know that, give me a second and ill report back
how do i use gparted to figure out if its ok?
Let me load up gparted...  I don't have it installed on this box
You can force a check of your drives by rebooting your computer with 'sudo shutdown -r -F now
